alert.note: Alert for Austin; Fort Bend; Waller; Wharton (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 24 at 12:53PM CST until January 24 at 3:00PM CST by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 245 PM CST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of south central Texas and southeast Texas, including the following counties, in south central Texas, Jackson. In southeast Texas, Austin, Colorado, Fort Bend, Waller and Wharton. * WHEN...Until 245 PM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1253 PM CST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 3.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... El Campo, Sealy, Eagle Lake, Ganado, Wallis, Simonton, San Felipe, southern Weston Lakes, Nada, Garwood, Egypt and Louise. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
